page.title: 20Farming around Eccleshall
page.content: The river Sow valley irrigates and drains a large acreage of rich meadow- land, making this a principal Midland dairy-farming area. A neighbouring milk collection depot, originally founded by Cadbury's, is now used by the Milk Marketing Board. Large numbers of store cattle graze some of the land, with smaller numbers of sheep, pigs and poultry, including a few rare breeds of sheep. Wheat and barley are main crops, with oilseed rape an alternative which makes use of the same machinery for harvesting. Eccleshall is a centre for subsidiary farming trades: machinery sales and repairs, a transport company, black- smith, sales of seeds and animal foodstuffs, medicines and chemical requirements, and a thriving veterinary surgery.
